image_1.description: Alice is a young girl with long hair, wearing a dress, standing between two mythical creatures, engaging with the Mock Turtle and the Gryphon, learning about the Lobster-Quadrille.

The Gryphon is a mythical creature with the body of a lion and the head and wings of an eagle, standing to the right of Alice, who helps explain the Lobster-Quadrille to Alice and also participates in a demonstration.
The Mock Turtle is a mythical creature that resembles a hybrid of a turtle and a calf, standing to the left of Alice, who explains the Lobster-Quadrille to Alice and participates in a demonstration.

image_2.description: The Lobster is a character in the poem 'Tis the voice of the Lobster,' which Alice recites. A lobster standing upright, dressed in a human-like outfit with a skirt and shoes, holding a hairbrush and looking into a mirror.

image_3.description: The White Rabbit is a character in Wonderland, dressed in a formal outfit with a coat adorned with heart patterns, holding a trumpet and a scroll, and is an official at the trial, calling for silence and reading the accusation.

image_4.description: The Mad Hatter, also known as the Hatter, is a whimsical character from Alice in Wonderland, characterized by his tall hat with a band reading '10/6', and his eccentric clothing including a checkered coat and mismatched shoes. He is the first witness called to testify in the trial, entering with a teacup and a piece of bread-and-butter, and is involved in a discussion about dates.

image_5.description: A character from Alice in Wonderland, also known as the Hatter, wearing a large top hat and holding a teapot and a cup, involved in the trial as the first witness. He is known for his anxious look at the Queen and his hurried exit from the court.

image_6.description: A young girl with long hair, wearing a light-colored dress with puffed sleeves, sitting on the ground in the court, involved in a trial and called as a witness.
The surface in the court where Alice is sitting and the animals are gathered.

image_7.description: The King of Hearts is a regal figure depicted with a crown, holding a scroll, and sitting on a throne in the court setting. He is a character who presides over the court, making rulings and interacting with Alice and the jury.
A decorative basket filled with items, placed near the guard, and is part of the setting in the court where the trial takes place.

image_8.description: A table in the setting of the trial, part of the court event in Wonderland, holds a decorative vase and a tray of tarts, which are a significant object in Alice's dream.

image_9.description: A young girl with long hair, wearing a dress, running and looking up, who is involved in a trial, questioning the King's rulings and the evidence presented, and is the main character who experiences a series of adventures in a dream-like world.
A rabbit running among the ducks and frogs, which is part of the strange creatures in Wonderland, including the White Rabbit who acts as a messenger and reader of evidence in the court.

image_10.description: Alice is the main character who experiences a series of adventures in a dream-like world. A young girl with long hair, dressed in a dress, standing and looking up at the knight.
Hatta is the White Knight, one of the chess pieces in the story. An elderly man in full armor, riding a horse, holding a sword and a shield.
The forest is a location Alice reaches during her journey. A dense forest with tall trees and a path where the characters are located.

image_11.description: The White King, Fawn, is one of the key chess pieces in the game of chess, positioned on the board, and also a character in Alice's dream in the story.
The Black King, Rose, is one of the key chess pieces in the game of chess, positioned on the board, and also a character in Alice's dream in the story.
The White Queen, Lily, is one of the most powerful chess pieces in the game of chess, positioned on the board, and also a character in Alice's dream in the story.
The White Knight, Hatta, is a piece that moves in an L-shape on the chessboard, representing one of the key pieces in the game of chess, and also a character in Alice's dream in the story.
The black knight is a piece that moves in an L-shape on the chessboard, representing one of the key pieces in the game of chess.

image_12.description: A black cat with a white patch on its chest, wearing a bow tie, and playing with a ball of yarn, also known as Dinah, who is responsible for washing the kittens' faces and is possibly the mother of the kittens.

image_13.description: A young girl with long, curly hair, sitting in an armchair and holding a black cat, who is the main character in the story, interacting with the kittens and engaging in imaginative conversations.

A small, black cat being held by Alice, who is one of Dinah's children, finished being washed earlier and blamed for the mischief, having a grand game of romps and causing mischief with the ball of worsted.

image_14.description: Alice is the main character in the text, a young girl with long hair, reaching up towards a mirror, interacting with the kittens and engaging in imaginative conversations, and imagining herself in a fantasy world called Looking-glass House.
A large, ornate mirror on the wall, which Alice passes through to enter the Looking-glass House, a central element in her fantasy.

The shelf above the fireplace where the clock and other objects are placed, also a notable feature in the Looking-glass House as Alice checks for a fire there and compares it to the one in her old room.

image_15.description: Alice is the main character in the story, who is a young girl with long hair, wearing a dress and striped stockings, standing on a mantelpiece, interacting with the kittens and engaging in imaginative conversations.
An ornately decorated mantelpiece with tassels and a decorative arch below it, where Alice stands and observes the chessmen in the hearth.

image_16.description: Alice is the main character in the story, who interacts with various entities, including the chess pieces, and navigates through the Looking-glass world. She is a young girl with a surprised expression, standing in the middle of a surreal chessboard scene.

The chess pieces in the story are animate and capable of walking about, which is a significant fantastical element in Alice's adventure. They include oversized characters such as a king, a queen, a knight, and a castle, all part of the surreal chessboard scene.
The Red Queen is a character from Alice's imagination, used as a model for her to pretend that the kitten is. She is also one of the chess pieces that Alice observes walking about.

The White Queen is one of the chess pieces that Alice interacts with, helping her to the table. She is characterized as a noisy little child causing a commotion, referred to as Lily, and is the daughter of the White Queen.

The White King is one of the chess pieces that Alice interacts with, helping him to the table. He struggles with writing and is observed by Alice as he uses a memorandum-book to write down his experiences.

image_17.description: A cartoon character wearing a crown and holding a scepter, appearing distressed as he is being squeezed by a large hand. The White King is one of the chess pieces that Alice interacts with, helping him to the table.

image_18.description: A cartoon character with a large nose, wearing a jacket and pants, walking on a tightrope, who is also known as the White Knight in the story.

image_19.description: A large, fierce dragon with wings and a long tail, appearing to be roaring or attacking, as depicted in the poem 'Jabberwocky' where the protagonist must beware of and slays the Jabberwock.
A dense forest that forms the background of the scene, similar to the Tulgey Wood mentioned in the poem 'Jabberwocky' where the Jabberwock is encountered.

image_20.description: Alice is the main character in the story, who is a young girl with long hair, wearing a dress, and standing in a garden. She navigates through the Looking-glass world, interacting with various entities and experiencing adventures in the garden.

The Garden of Live Flowers is a lush garden setting with a variety of plants and flowers, including Tiger-lily, Rose, and Daisy, where Alice encounters a unique and fantastical environment. It is also the location of a large flower-bed with a border of daisies and a willow-tree growing in the middle.

image_21.description: Alice is the main character in the story, who interacts with talking flowers and experiences adventures in a fantastical garden. She is also depicted as a young girl with long hair, wearing a dress and an apron, standing in a forest.

The Red Queen is a character whom Alice encounters in the garden, who has grown in size and is taller than Alice. She is also depicted as a queen character from the story, depicted as a chess piece with a crown and holding a scepter, standing on a pedestal.

image_22.description: A large, old tree with a thick trunk and sprawling branches, where Alice rests after running with the Queen, representing a moment of pause in her journey.

An expansive field divided into a checkerboard pattern of alternating light and dark squares, resembling a large chess-board where Alice interacts with various entities and navigates through different squares and challenges.

image_23.description: Alice is the main character in the story, exploring the garden and interacting with various flowers, the Red Queen, and the King of Hearts. She is depicted as a young girl with long hair, wearing a dress, and is involved in a great huge game of chess being played all over the world.

image_25.description: Alice is the main character in the story, interacting with various entities and navigating through different squares and challenges. She is a young girl with long hair, wearing a dress and a hat, sitting on a bench in a train compartment.

The Conductor is a character in the story who is also known as the Guard. He is a man in a uniform looking through a telescope from outside the train window and demands tickets from the passengers, including Alice, on the train.

The Man with Newspaper is an older man wearing a conical hat, reading a newspaper, and sitting opposite Alice in the train compartment. He is also referred to as the gentleman in white paper, offering advice to Alice.

image_27.description: The Gnat is an anthropomorphic insect, capable of conversation with Alice, balancing on a twig, and fanning her with its wings. It is described as being about the size of a chicken and engages in a philosophical discussion about the usefulness of names.

image_29.description: Alice is the main character in the text, experiencing a surreal journey and interacting with various characters, including a large Gnat, and appears to be in a state of confusion or surprise as she seems to be floating or falling.

image_30.description: Alice is the main character in the text, a young girl with long hair, wearing a dress, standing in a forest, and holding a fawn. She is also seen exploring a fantastical world, having conversations with various insects, and trying to find her way to the Eighth Square.
The Fawn is a gentle creature that Alice encounters in the Wood, who helps her remember her name. It is a small, spotted deer being held by Alice and has large gentle eyes.

The Forest, also referred to as the Wood, is a dense area with tall trees and underbrush where Alice encounters various talking insects and the Fawn. It is described as a dark and mysterious place that Alice must enter to reach the Eighth Square, where things have no names.
